ITEM.TITLE: Ensure mounting of cramfs filesystems is disabled
ITEM.DESCRIPTION:
The cramfs filesystem type is a compressed read-only Linux filesystem embedded in small
footprint systems. A cramfs image can be used without having to first decompress the image.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure mounting of freevxfs filesystems is disabled
ITEM.DESCRIPTION:
The freevxfs filesystem type is a free version of the Veritas type filesystem. This is the
primary filesystem type for HP-UX operating systems.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure mounting of jffs2 filesystems is disabled
ITEM.DESCRIPTION:
The jffs2 (journaling flash filesystem 2) filesystem type is a log-structured filesystem
used in flash memory devices.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure mounting of hfs filesystems is disabled
ITEM.DESCRIPTION:
The hfs filesystem type is a hierarchical filesystem that allows you to mount Mac OS
filesystems.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure mounting of hfsplus filesystems is disabled
ITEM.DESCRIPTION:
The hfsplus filesystem type is a hierarchical filesystem designed to replace hfs that
allows you to mount Mac OS filesystems.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure mounting of squashfs filesystems is disabled
ITEM.DESCRIPTION:
The squashfs filesystem type is a compressed read-only Linux filesystem embedded in
small footprint systems (similar to cramfs). A squashfs image can be used without having
to first decompress the image.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure mounting of udf filesystems is disabled
ITEM.DESCRIPTION:
The udf filesystem type is the universal disk format used to implement ISO/IEC 13346 and
ECMA-167 specifications. This is an open vendor filesystem type for data storage on a
broad range of media. This filesystem type is necessary to support writing DVDs and newer
optical disc formats.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure mounting of vfat filesystems is disabled
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Removing support for unneeded filesystem types reduces the local attack surface of the server.
ITEM.CAUTION:
FAT filesystems are often used on portable USB sticks and other flash media are commonly
used to transfer files between workstations, removing VFAT support may prevent the
ability to transfer files in this way.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure separate partition exists for /tmp
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The /tmp directory is a world-writable directory used for temporary storage by all users and some applications.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure nodev option set on /tmp partition
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The nodev mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain special devices.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure nosuid option set on /tmp partition
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The nosuid mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain setuid files.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure noexec option set on /tmp partition
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The noexec mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain executable binaries.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure separate partition exists for /var
ITEM.DESCRIPTION:
The /var directory is used by daemons and other system services to temporarily store
dynamic data. Some directories created by these processes may be world-writable.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure separate partition exists for /var/tmp
ITEM.DESCRIPTION:
The /var/tmp directory is a world-writable directory used for temporary storage by all
users and some applications.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure nodev option set on /var/tmp partition
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The nodev mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain special devices.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure nosuid option set on /var/tmp partition
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The nosuid mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain setuid files.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure noexec option set on /var/tmp partition
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The noexec mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain executable binaries.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure separate partition exists for /var/log
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The /var/log directory is used by system services to store log data.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure separate partition exists for /var/log/audit
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The auditing daemon, auditd, stores log data in the /var/log/audit directory.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure separate partition exists for /home
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The /home directory is used to support disk storage needs of local users.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure nodev option set on /home partition
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The nodev mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain special devices.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure nodev option set on /dev/shm partition
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The nodev mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain special devices.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure nosuid option set on /dev/shm partition
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The nosuid mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain setuid files.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure noexec option set on /dev/shm partition
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The noexec mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain executable binaries.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure nodev option set on /media partition
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The nodev mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain special devices.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure nosuid option set on /media partition
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The nosuid mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain setuid files.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure noexec option set on /media partition
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: The noexec mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain executable binaries.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure sticky bit is set on all world-writable directories
ITEM.DESCRIPTION:
Setting the sticky bit on world writable directories prevents users from deleting or
renaming files in that directory that are not owned by them.

ITEM.TITLE: Disable Automounting
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: autofs allows automatic mounting of devices, typically including CD/DVDs and USB drives.
ITEM.CAUTION:
The use portable hard drives is very common for workstation users. If your organization
allows the use of portable storage or media on workstations and physical access controls to
workstations is considered adequate there is little value add in turning off automounting.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure package manager repositories are configured
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Systems need to have package manager repositories configured to ensure they receive the latest patches and updates.

ITEM.TITLE: Ensure GPG keys are configured
ITEM.DESCRIPTION: Most packages managers implement GPG key signing to verify package integrity during installation.
ITEM.ACTION: Delete all gpg repositories except Centos or EPEL
